780316efaa952915ee1aa3396f041ee2982b0b4","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://2f8f2a76e23b02fc69e8cd24c3cb47da6c7af3a2d6c3a382f8ac25c6e094ade7","dweb:/ipfs/QmPV4ZS4tPVv4mTCf9ejyZ1ai57EEibDRj7mN2ARDCLV5n"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Address.sol":{"keccak256":"0xaf28a975a78550e45f65e559a3ad6a5ad43b9b8a37366999abd1b7084eb70721","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://b7bd24e224f67f65bfadf85dc2929fa965456bb2415478bd0125471b5ce35245","dweb:/ipfs/QmRaydGr8BTHs1kvaZfsNU69pKzUAGFrvABn1KiRSbE51y"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/StorageSlot.sol":{"keccak256":"0x32ba59b4b7299237c8ba56319110989d7978a039faf754793064e967e5894418","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://1ae50c8b562427df610cc4540c9bf104acca7ef8e2dcae567ae7e52272281e9c","dweb:/ipfs/QmTHiadFCSJUPpRjNegc5SahmeU8bAoY8i9Aq6tVscbcKR"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/introspection/IERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0x4296879f55019b23e135000eb36896057e7101fb7fb859c5ef690cf14643757b","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://87b3541437c8c443ccd36795e56a338ed12855eec17f8da624511b8d1a7e14df","dweb:/ipfs/QmeJQCtZrQjtJLr6u7ZHWeH3pBnjtLWzvRrKViAi7UZqxL"]},"src/MarketplaceBlockcoder.sol":{"keccak256":"0x3804c80590574a76d527ddfe026bcc8b12b427a2fba849e36e074422333f6560","license":"UNLICENSED","urls":["bzz-raw://0f95fddf75e6daf823d972e5161beafb5ce97d8cc8d80993b371e3a75987274d","dweb:/ipfs/QmXiFvPDbm1mGT4yv3UyS3DzqH7AjUwHgmthALpzDQNRv4"]}},"version":1}

params._buyOfferIdCounter: The identifier of the buy offer to be accepted.

params._sellOfferIdCounter: The identifier of the sell offer to be accepted.

params._buyOfferIdCounter: The identifier of the buy offer to be cancelled.

params._sellOfferIdCounter: The identifier of the sell offer to be cancelled.

createBuyOffer(address,uint256,uint256).details: Function to create buy offers for NFTs.

params._deadline: The deadline for accepting the buy offer.
params._nftAddress: The address of the NFT contract.
params._tokenId: The ID of the NFT to be offered for purchase.

createSellOffer(address,uint256,uint256,.details: Function to create sell offers for NFTs.

params._deadline: The deadline for accepting the sell offer.
params._nftAddress: The address of the NFT contract.
params._price: The price in ETH for the sell offer.
params._tokenId: The ID of the NFT to be offered for sale.

getBuyOffer(uint256).details: Retrieves the details of a buy offer.

params.offerId: The ID of the buy offer.

returns._0: nftAddress The address of the NFT contract associated with the offer.
returns._1: offerer The address of the offer creator.
returns._2: tokenId The ID of the NFT being offered.
returns._3: price The price of the offer in ETH.
returns._4: deadline The specific time or date by which the offer must be accepted.
returns._5: isEnded A boolean indicating whether the offer has ended.

getSellOffer(uint256).details: Retrieves the details of a sell offer.

params.offerId: The ID of the sell offer.

returns._0: nftAddress The address of the NFT contract associated with the offer.
returns._1: offerer The address of the offer creator.
returns._2: tokenId The ID of the NFT being offered.
returns._3: price The price of the offer in ETH.
returns._4: deadline The specific time or date by which the offer must be accepted.
returns._5: isEnded A boolean indicating whether the offer has ended.

onERC721Received(address,address,uint256.details: Allows the contract to receive an NFT. This function can be called to handle the reception of Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs). Implement custom logic within the function body to process the received NFT as needed. Emits no events by default. Any additional actions or events related to the received NFT should be specified within the function's implementation.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

acceptBuyOffer(uint256).notice: Ensure that the sender is the owner of the NFT being offered.Ensure that the buy offer is valid and not already ended.Ensure that the deadline for the buy offer has not passed.

acceptSellOffer(uint256).notice: Ensure that the sender send sufficient value with their transaction to cover the asking price of the NFT.ESnsure that the sell offer is valid and not already ended.Ensure that the deadline for the sell offer has not passed.

cancelBuyOffer(uint256).notice: Ensure that the buy offer is not already ended.Ensure that the sender is the owner of the buy offer.Ensure that the deadline for the buy offer has not passed.

cancelSellOffer(uint256).notice: Ensure that the sell offer is not already ended.Ensure that the sender is the owner of the sell offer.Ensure that the deadline for the sell offer has not passed.

createBuyOffer(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Ensure that the provided NFT address and token ID are valid.Ensure that the deadline is set in the future.Ensure that a valid amount of Ether is sent with the transaction.

createSellOffer(address,uint256,uint256,.notice: Ensure that the provided NFT address and token ID are valid.Ensure that the deadline is set in the future.

initialize(string).notice: With the initialize we don´t need constructorthat is the owner of the proxy, not this implementation

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Only the contract's owner can call this method"

arguments.value: Only the contract's owner can call this method

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Only the contract's owner can call this method"

documentation.text: @dev Modifier to ensure that only the owner can execute certain functions

@dev Allows the contract to receive an NFT.
 This function can be called to handle the reception of Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs).
 Implement custom logic within the function body to process the received NFT as needed.
 Emits no events by default. Any additional actions or events related to the received NFT
 should be specified within the function's implementation.

@dev This function is executed when the contract receives Ether without accompanying data.
 @notice Ether sent with this transaction is added to the contract's balance.
